model

Class GameState

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.GameState

  • public class GameState
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a GameState, which represents the pieces interactions.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameState

        public GameState(int opponentType,
                 java.lang.String stockfishPath)
        Constructs a GameState with the initial chess map accordingly to the the amount of players selected
        Parameters:
        opponentType - Opponent type selected: 0 for Player vs AI, 1 for two Players in the same devices, 2 for two Players in different devices.
        stockfishPath - path to the process that launches AI.

      • GameState

        public GameState(int opponentType,
                 java.lang.String stockfishPath,
                 Server server)
        Constructs a GameState with the initial chess map accordingly to the the amount of players selected
        Parameters:
        opponentType - Opponent type selected: 0 for Player vs AI, 1 for two Players in the same devices, 2 for two Players in different devices.
        stockfishPath - path to the process that launches AI.
        server - Server which hosts the game.

      • GameState

        public GameState(int opponentType,
                 java.lang.String stockfishPath,
                 Client client)
        Constructs a GameState with the initial chess map accordingly to the the amount of players selected
        Parameters:
        opponentType - Opponent type selected: 0 for Player vs AI, 1 for two Players in the same devices, 2 for two Players in different devices.
        stockfishPath - path to the process that launches AI.
        client - Client that connects to the server.

      • GameState

        public GameState(int opponentType,
                 java.lang.String stockfishPath,
                 boolean testFlag)
        Constructs a GameState with the initial chess map accordingly to the the amount of players selected
        Parameters:
        opponentType - Opponent type selected: 0 for Player vs AI, 1 for two Players in the same devices, 2 for two Players in different devices.
        stockfishPath - path to the process that launches AI.
        testFlag - Flag necessary to test the game.

                           Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> kingPos)

      • verifyCheckMate

                               Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> kingPos)
        Verifies if the game is over by checking any check-mate to a specific king
        Parameters:
        p - player that makes the check.
        kingPos - position of the threatened king.
        Returns:
        true if check-mate, false otherwise

      • isKingCornered

        public boolean isKingCornered(int p,
                              Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> kingPos)
        Verifies if the threatened king has no place to move
        Parameters:
        p - player that makes the check.
        kingPos - position of the threatened king.
        Returns:
        true if king cannot move, false otherwise.

      • isKingIndefensible

        public boolean isKingIndefensible(int p,
                                  Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> kingPos)
        Verifies if there is any piece capable of defending the king that is in check.
        Parameters:
        p - player that makes the check.
        kingPos - position of the threatened king.
        Returns:
        true if king is indefensible, false otherwise.

      • trimGetPossible

        public java.util.ArrayList<Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer>> trimGetPossible(Character ch,

        Trims a certain piece character moves accordingly to the checks and possible-checks in the current gamestate.
        Parameters:
        ch - player which possible moves will be trimmed.
        arr - character possible moves.
        Returns:
        the trimmed possible moves of the character.

      • isPossible

        public boolean isPossible(Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> pos,
                          java.util.ArrayList<Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer>> arr)
        Checks if a current character position is among a set of another character possible moves.
        Parameters:
        pos - first character actual position
        arr - first character possible moves.
        Returns:
        true if position is contained, false otherwise.
